intro: Capurodendron ankaranense, commonly known as the Ankaranese tree, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the rainy season. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
